sentences: Ei öelnud, lausunud, vastanud selle peale musta ega valget.
Ta ei öelnud musta ega valget kõigest sündmusest.
Isane ja emane on nagu must ja valge.
context: The Estonian phrase 'musta ega valget' is an idiom that means 'neither black nor white'. It's used when someone refuses to talk about something or remains completely silent on a topic. The expression literally refers to not speaking words associated with colors (black and white) but has evolved to mean saying nothing at all about a particular subject.
